intro: Aeschynomene butayei, commonly known as Brazilian millet, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid conditions, making it a hardy species. It has potential agricultural use as a forage crop and is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. Its ecological role includes supporting local biodiversity and contributing to soil stabilization.
